intro: Siparuna killipii, commonly known as the red-flowered siparuna, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to the Amazon Basin. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and clusters of vibrant red flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its ornamental value is enhanced by the striking contrast between its dark green foliage and bright red blooms. Siparuna killipii is also valued in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
